intro: Globulea impressa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant produces small, rounded seed capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Globulea impressa thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for both horticultural and scientific study.
